messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] help with kanji...
messages.msgSnippet: This JO is the kanji for castle is it not??  Hence Tom s reference to Tsuru(ga) Jo - Crane Castle - actually White Crane Castle
messages.messageBody:
This JO is the kanji for 'castle' is it not?? Hence Tom's reference to Tsuru(ga) Jo - 'Crane Castle' - actually White Crane Castle http://www.flickr.com/photos/queenscents/2662335097/

Probably a coincidence???

Regards,
Barry Thomas.


----- Original Message -----
From: Richard Turner
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, July 25, 2009 10:55 AM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] help with kanji...


Tsuru could also be Kaku ?? There are several using this kanji in the
Haynes index.

Tom are you referring to Tsurujo, the female tosu-shi ?

Cheers

Rich

Richard -
Would that be Jo? as in Tsuruga-Jo (Himeji) I should be very curious if
this is so. Got more pics?
-t

Original Message:
-----------------
From: Richard George rkg@...
Date: Fri, 24 Jul 2009 10:05:00 -0700
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [nihontostudy] help with kanji...


Hi,

I'm trying to finish up a little project, and am having trouble
deciphering the mei on a piece;

here's a pic:

http://www.rkgphotos.com/recent_stuff/arty_tsuba/georges-dragon.jpg

The first character is "tsuru" (crane), but I can't get the second. Can
anybody help out on this?

Thanks,

rkg
(Richard George)

messages.subject: help with kanji...
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, I m trying to finish up a little project, and am having trouble deciphering the mei on a piece; here s a pic:
messages.messageBody:
Hi,

I'm trying to finish up a little project, and am having trouble
deciphering the mei on a piece;

here's a pic:

http://www.rkgphotos.com/recent_stuff/arty_tsuba/georges-dragon.jpg

The first character is "tsuru" (crane), but I can't get the second. Can
anybody help out on this?

Thanks,

rkg
(Richard George)
